content.description: Semi-dynamic coordination move stand start and then top out on rough slopers. Step on the round outcropping (I use right foot but I'm sure left is doable too), jump/stand up on that foot and grab an undercling with each hand at about chest level to stabilize. Use rough slopers and bad feet to work your way up and over.

There area  number of variations up the easy slab on the far back of the Coffin boulder that make nice quick warm ups to get the blood flowing. If you turn around there are much better, much higher slab/vert easy problems that can feel a little spicy for warm ups.
content.location: From facing the prow walk on the right side of the boulder to the back and climb the short slab where the moss has been brushed away.

content.description: I'm putting this here at v11 but I'll need feedback on the grade for certain. I'm not confirming it's v11 it's more of a placeholder but it feels like 11 to me. Match start on the micro-edge at the lowest part of the right-hand hold on sunspots. Either go up left into the sloper seam or use the left hand on sunspots as an intermediate. From there finish the same as sunspots.

A short problem on the rough slopers/crystals of the belly button wall. Start on two of the three-four possible rough slopers in the crack (see photo) with left foot on the crystal jib. Slap a left on the sloper over the ridge. Get right hand on the other rough patch up there and right foot high in the curved crack (start hold of Trance). Grab the squarish block as a right gaston. Throw over the top left or get a high right foot on the slopy ridge and mantle.
content.location: A few feet right of the arete and just left of Trance and other belly button problems left of the tree.

content.description: Start as far to the right on the sloper rail as you can get and then work your way left to the juggy sloper over the lip. Topout left.Not sure if this is an FA or not. It's probably been done before but I'm not really sure.
content.location: Just to the right of Sun Stripes starting on the sloper rail.

content.description: Start right-hand gaston and left hand on the side pull shallow crimp. Move up into the seam left hand or toss out right hand over the lip. Match and top out left. Potential for a low start matching the right hand that would probably go at around v11.
content.location: The vertical on the same boulder as the Coffin directly to the right off belly button arete.

content.description: Stand-start on rough jug as far down and right as you can go. Go left to one of the two small, sharp crimps then either grab the other one right or go right up over the lip. Jump out to a high left hand (or use high feet/heels to do it static) and work your way up and over. You'll end up using the handholds on the right side of  the Coffin as footholds for the second half.
content.location: This is the wall on the right side of The Coffin prow. Start as low and right as you can go and suck your body in a bit to avoid the other big ground boulder.

content.description: Start matched on the far right undercling and traverse left. Work your way through the underclings and up to the slopers over the lip.I'm unsure as to who got FA on this. I feel like this thing goes at around v5 so I'll be putting it at that. If anyone knows who got the FA or what the original grade was let me know!
content.location: To the right of Sun Spots and directly around the left side of the Coffin.

content.description: A tight spot between the trees and rock. Stand start with left hand on the slopey lip, and get a high right foot, and rock over to the easier top out slab. If you can't reach the lip, it might be because I did it over a snow bank. Probably done before, but should be included!
content.location: Middle of the wall at slopey horizontal breaks.... it's where the trees are closest to the boulder.

content.description: Slap your way out the prow on this compression problem.Note COMMENT about middle jog breaking off.
Sit start with dismal feet and your hand on a jug and head up the nice holds of the arete to top out.  Avoid the block to the side for the feet (using that or stand start makes it v0).
content.location: On the opposite side of the boulder to the Coffin.  Facing the Coffin walk on the left side of the boulder all the way back to the end.

content.description: This boulder is really long and has lines on the face next to it as well. The classic v7 The Coffin is an easily identifiable prow sticking out covered in chalk. Facing the prow the left side has the Belly Button Wall v4 and Belly Button Arete v1. The right side has quite a number of problems on it as well with a number of easy short v0s towards the end of it.  The wall facing the right side has many easy tall lines with good top outs.
